channel.title: Context Engineering Daily
channel.description: Daily news and research updates in AI Context Engineering, Prompt Engineering, RAG, and LLM development

item.title: DeepSearchQA: Bridging the Comprehensiveness Gap for Deep Research Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.20975v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce DeepSearchQA, a 900-prompt benchmark for evaluating agents on difficult multi-step information-seeking tasks across 17 different fields. Unlike traditional benchmarks that target single answer retrieval or broad-spectrum factuality, DeepS...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, model, tool, context, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: asr_eval: Algorithms and tools for multi-reference and streaming speech recognition evaluation
item.description: arXiv:2601.20992v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose several improvements to the speech recognition evaluation. First, we propose a string alignment algorithm that supports both multi-reference labeling, arbitrary-length insertions and better word alignment. This is especially useful for non-...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> study, model, tool, ICL, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: UrduBench: An Urdu Reasoning Benchmark using Contextually Ensembled Translations with Human-in-the-Loop
item.description: arXiv:2601.21000v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have led to strong reasoning capabilities; however, evaluating such models in low-resource languages remains challenging due to the lack of standardized benchmarks. In particular, Urdu reasoning evaluati...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, LLM, instruction, paper, analysis | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Position-invariant Fine-tuning of Speech Enhancement Models with Self-supervised Speech Representations
item.description: arXiv:2601.21084v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Integrating front-end speech enhancement (SE) models with self-supervised learning (SSL)-based speech models is effective for downstream tasks in noisy conditions. SE models are commonly fine-tuned using SSL representations with mean squared error (MS...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, embedding, arxiv, experiment, fine-tuning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: ChunkWise LoRA: Adaptive Sequence Partitioning for Memory-Efficient Low-Rank Adaptation and Accelerated LLM Inference
item.description: arXiv:2601.21109v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in low-rank adaptation (LoRA) have enabled efficient fine-tuning of large language models (LLMs) with minimal additional parameters. However, existing LoRA methods apply static rank configurations uniformly across all input tokens, ign...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, model, large language model, transformer, framework | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Multi-task Code LLMs: Data Mix or Model Merge?
item.description: arXiv:2601.21115v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent research advocates deploying smaller, specialized code LLMs in agentic frameworks alongside frontier models, sparking interest in efficient strategies for multi-task learning that balance performance, constraints, and costs. We compare two appr...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, model, analysis, framework, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Large Language Models Naively Recover Ethnicity from Individual Records
item.description: arXiv:2601.21132v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: I demonstrate that large language models can infer ethnicity from names with accuracy exceeding that of Bayesian Improved Surname Geocoding (BISG) without additional training data, enabling inference outside the United States and to contextually appro...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, model, large language model, context, transformer | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Output-Space Search: Targeting LLM Generations in a Frozen Encoder-Defined Output Space
item.description: arXiv:2601.21169v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce Output-Space Search (OS-Search), which turns LLM generation into endpoint search. An outer loop selects a target z* in a frozen encoder-defined 3D output space Z, and a retrieval-grounded policy trained with sequence-level RL generates ou...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> retrieval, prompt, arxiv, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: From Linear Input to Hierarchical Structure: Function Words as Statistical Cues for Language Learning
item.description: arXiv:2601.21191v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: What statistical conditions support learning hierarchical structure from linear input? In this paper, we address this question by focusing on the statistical distribution of function words. Function words have long been argued to play a crucial role i...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, analysis, paper, arxiv, alignment | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." â€” Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.

item.title: ThinkSound - [NeurIPS 2025] PyTorch implementation of [ThinkSound], a unified framework for generating audio from any modality, guided by Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning.

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, LLM, model, tool, context | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, model, knowledge base, RAG, vector | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
